tags.description:
If you're an administrator, use these operations to create and manage
users on your account.
tags.name: Users

tags.description:
If you're an administrator, use these operations to manage the list
of properties and includes blocked for a user.
tags.name: Blocked assets

tags.description:
Use these operations to manage your or, if you're an administrator,
other users' authentication settings.
tags.name: User authentication settings

tags.description:
If you're an administrator, use these operations to manage a user's
multi-factor authentication.
tags.name: User access

tags.description:
If you're an administrator, use these operations to Set up email notifications
to remind users about maintenance tasks.
tags.name: User notifications

tags.description:
If you're an administrator, use these operations toManage a user's
group and role assignments.
tags.name: User authorization settings

post.description: This operation creates a user, or clones an existing user's role assignments, in the account specified in your API client credentials. Optionally, sends a randomly generated one-time use password to the new user. If you send the email with the password directly to the user, the response for this operation doesn't include that password. If you don't send the password to the user through email, the password is included in the response.

parameters.name: sendEmail
parameters.description: Sends a one-time password to the new user, `true` by default.

authGrants.roleDescription: Provides users with the maximum access to users.

additionalAuthentication.description: Specifies the user's multi-factor authentication method, confirming their identity. Either `TFA`, `MFA`, or `NONE`, which offers no additional authentication.

authGrants.description: The user's role assignments, per group. The user needs to have at least one group role assigned. Account level roles are optional. Provide either this or the `cloneFrom`.

oneOf.description: The user's role assignments, per group. Provide either this or the `cloneFrom`.
oneOf.title: Group role

isBlocked.description: Blocks a user's access to a group.

roleId.description: Unique identifier for each role. To get this value, run the [List roles](ref:get-roles) operation. You need to assign at least one role to a user. Setting the value to `null` in POST leaves the default role: either unassigned or cascaded from a parent group. For `PUT`, it clears the current assignment and reverts it to the default role.

groupId.description: Unique identifier for each group. To get this value, run the [List groups](ref:get-groups) operation.

roleDescription.description: Descriptive label for the role to convey its use.

subGroups.description: Children of the parent group. Permissions cascade downward from parent to child unless the child group's `isBlocked` is `true`.

groupId.description: Unique identifier for each group.

isBlocked.description: Blocks a user's access to a group.

roleId.description: Unique identifier for each role. To get this value, run the [List roles](ref:get-roles) operation. You need to assign at least one role to a user. Setting the value to `null` in POST leaves the default role: either unassigned or cascaded from a parent group. For `PUT`, it clears the current assignment and reverts it to the default role.

subGroups.description: Children of the parent group. Permissions cascade downward from parent to child unless the child group's `isBlocked` is `true`.

oneOf.description: The user's account level role assignments.
oneOf.title: Account level role

roleId.description: Unique identifier for each role. To get this value, run the [List roles](ref:get-roles) operation and look for roles with the `account` type.

roleDescription.description: Descriptive label for the role to convey its use.

cloneFrom.description: The username to clone a user's `authGrants` from. Provide either this or the `authGrants`.

contactType.description: User's contact type. To get the available values, run the [View contact types](ref:get-common-contact-types) operation.

country.description: User's country. To get the available values, run the [View supported countries](ref:get-common-countries) operation.

email.description: The user's email address. It needs to be a valid email address users can access, as they'll be sent a OTP to enter while logging in for the first time. To learn more, see [Frequently asked questions](https://techdocs.akamai.com/iam/docs/frequently-asked-questions-gss#why-am-i-asked-to-enter-a-code-while-logging-in).

jobTitle.description: The user's position at the company.

mobilePhone.description: The user's mobile phone number in ITU-T E.164 format, that is, `+country code-area code-subscriber number`. For example, `+3551234567891` or `+441234567891`. For Canadian and US phone numbers, you can provide them with a country code (for example, `+11234567891`) or without it as a ten-digit integer within a string (for example, `1234567891`).

notifications.description: Specifies email notifications the user receives for products.

apiClientCredentialExpiryNotification.description: Enables notifications for expiring API client credentials.

newUserNotification.description: Enables notifications for group administrators when the user creates other new users.

proactive.description: Products for which the user gets notifications for service issues.

upgrade.description: Products for which the user receives notifications for upgrades.

phone.description: The user's mobile phone number in ITU-T E.164 format, that is, `+country code-area code-subscriber number`. For example, `+3551234567891` or `+441234567891`. For Canadian and US phone numbers, you can provide them with a country code (for example, `+11234567891`) or without it as a ten-digit integer within a string (for example, `1234567891`).

preferredLanguage.description: The user's language. To get the available values, run the [View languages](ref:get-common-languages) operation.

sessionTimeOut.description: The number of seconds it takes for the user's Control Center session to time out after no activity. To get the available values, run the [View timeout policies](ref:get-common-timeout-policies) operation. Make sure to select a value that's equal or smaller to the **Max session timeout** value, set for your account in the Identity and Access Management interface's [Settings](https://techdocs.akamai.com/iam/docs/account-settings) tab.

state.description: The user's state or province if user's country is USA or Canada. To get the available values, run the [View states for a user profile](ref:get-user-states) operation.

timeZone.description: The user's time zone. To get the available values, run the [View time zones](ref:get-common-timezones) operation.

zipCode.description: The user's five-digit postal code, represented as a string.

Location.description: A URL path to the newly created object.

authGrants.roleDescription: Provides the maximum access to users.

actions.description: Specifies permissions available to the user for this group. This data is available when you specify the `actions` parameter of the same name, not to be confused with the `action` parameter that applies to the [Set two-factor authentication](ref:put-user-profile-tfa) operation.

apiClient.description: Enables the administrator to create an API client.

isCloneable.description: Enables an administrator to create a new user with permissions cloned from this user.

resetPassword.description: Enables an administrator to send a user a password by email or see a one-time token.

thirdPartyAccess.description: Enables the administrator to manage extended access.

additionalAuthentication.description: Specifies the user's multi-factor authentication method, confirming their identity. Either `TFA`, `MFA`, or `NONE`, which offers no additional authentication.

additionalAuthenticationConfigured.description: Whether the user has multi-factor authentication configured.

authGrants.description: A user's role assignments, per group.

items.description: A user's role assignments, per group.

groupId.description: Unique identifier for each group. It's returned only for group roles.

isBlocked.description: Whether a user's access to a group is blocked.

roleDescription.description: Descriptive label for the role to convey its use.

roleId.description: Unique identifier for each role.

subGroups.description: Children of the parent group. Permissions cascade downward from parent to child unless the child group's `isBlocked` is `true`.

emailUpdatePending.description: Whether there are any pending changes to the email address.

isLocked.description: Whether the user's account is locked. To learn more, see [Temporary account lockout](https://techdocs.akamai.com/iam/docs/tmp-account-lockout).

jobTitle.description: The user's position at the company.

lastLoginDate.description: ISO 8601 timestamp indicating when the user last logged in.

mobilePhone.description: The user's mobile phone number in ITU-T E.164 format, that is, `+country code-area code-subscriber number`.

notifications.description: Specifies email notifications the user receives for products.

apiClientCredentialExpiryNotification.description: Whether the user gets notifications for expiring API client credentials.

newUserNotification.description: Whether group administrators get notifications when the user creates other new users.

passwordExpiry.description: Whether the user gets notifications for password expiration.

proactive.description: Products for which the user gets notifications for service issues.

upgrade.description: Products for which the user receives notifications for upgrades.

passwordExpiryDate.description: The date a user's password expires.

phone.description: The user's mobile phone number in ITU-T E.164 format, that is, `+country code-area code-subscriber number`.

sessionTimeOut.description: The number of seconds it takes for the user's Control Center session to time out after no activity.

state.description: The user's state or province if user's country is USA or Canada.

timeZone.description: The user's time zone. To get the available values, run the [View time zones](ref:get-common-timezones) operation.

uiIdentityId.description: Unique identifier for each user, which corresponds to their Control Center profile or client ID. Also known as a `contactId` in other APIs.

uiUserName.description: The user's username in Control Center.

zipCode.description: The user's five-digit postal code, represented as a string.

get.description: This operation lists the users who have access to your current account or other managed accounts using the `accountSwitchKey` parameter. The account is determined by the tokens in your API client. You can pass a `groupId` to filter users based on group. You can also return user information such as what product notifications they subscribe to, or what group and role assignments they have. Set  the `actions` parameter to `true` to return the actions you can take on each user.

parameters.description: Filters roles for a specific group. To get this value, run the [List groups](ref:get-groups) operation.
parameters.name: groupId

parameters.description: Includes the list of your group and role assignments, `false` by default.
parameters.name: authGrants

parameters.description: Includes actions such as `edit` or `delete` that a user can perform on an object, `false` by default. Don't confuse this with the `action` parameter, which applies to the [Set two-factor authentication](ref:put-user-profile-tfa) operation.
parameters.name: actions

200.description: The response provides the users on the account.

actions.description: Specifies permissions available to the user for this group. This data is available when you specify the `actions` parameter of the same name, not to be confused with the `action` parameter that applies to the [Set two-factor authentication](ref:put-user-profile-tfa) operation.

apiClient.description: Enables the administrator to create an API client.

canEditMFA.description: With a `true` value, the user can turn their MFA setting on or off.

canEditNone.description: With a `true` value, the user can turn their None setting on or off.

canEditTFA.description: With a `true` value, the user can turn their TFA setting on or off.

editProfile.description: With a `true` value, the user can edit their user profile.

isCloneable.description: Enables an administrator to create a new user with permissions cloned from this user.

resetPassword.description: Enables an administrator to send a user a password by email or see a one-time token.

roleId.description: Unique identifier for each role.

subGroups.description: Children of the parent group. Permissions cascade downward from parent to child unless the child group's `isBlocked` is `true`.

uiUserName.description: The user's username in Control Center.

delete.description: This operation deletes any user who doesn't own an API client. Before you delete a user with a client, [transfer API client ownership](https://techdocs.akamai.com/iam/docs/transfer-api-client-ownership) to another user.

parameters.description: Unique identifier for each user. To get this value, run the [List users](ref:get-ui-identities) operation.
parameters.name: uiIdentityId

put.description: This operation sets a user's multi-factor authentication to `TFA`, `MFA`, or `NONE`. Users are allowed five login attempts with MFA or 2FA before their account is locked. If the account is locked, use the [Reset additional authentication](ref:put-ui-identity-reset-additional-authentication) to unlock it.

value.description: A user's multi-factor authentication method, either `TFA`, `MFA`, or `NONE`.

parameters.description: Unique identifier for each user. To get this value, run the [List users](ref:get-ui-identities) operation.
parameters.name: uiIdentityId

put.description: This operation prompts the reset of a user's multi-factor authentication method the next time they log in to Control Center. `TFA` indicates two-factor authentication. `MFA` indicates Akamai MFA authentication.

parameters.description: Unique identifier for each user. To get this value, run the [List users](ref:get-ui-identities) operation.
parameters.name: uiIdentityId

put.description: This operation edits what groups a user has access to, and how the user interacts with the objects in those groups.

schema.description: Roles assigned to the user. A user needs to have at least one group role assigned. Account level roles are optional.

oneOf.description: The user's role assignments, per group. Provide either this or the `cloneFrom`.
oneOf.title: Group role

isBlocked.description: Blocks a user's access to a group.

roleId.description: Unique identifier for each role. To get this value, run the [List roles](ref:get-roles) operation. You need to assign at least one role to a user. Setting the value to `null` in POST leaves the default role: either unassigned or cascaded from a parent group. For `PUT`, it clears the current assignment and reverts it to the default role.

groupId.description: Unique identifier for each group. To get this value, run the [List groups](ref:get-groups) operation.

roleDescription.description: Descriptive label for the role to convey its use.

subGroups.description: Children of the parent group. Permissions cascade downward from parent to child unless the child group's `isBlocked` is `true`.

groupId.description: Unique identifier for each group.

isBlocked.description: Blocks a user's access to a group.

Setting the value to `null` in POST leaves the default role: either unassigned or cascaded from a parent group. For `PUT`, it clears the current assignment and reverts it to the default role.

subGroups.description: Children of the parent group. Permissions cascade downward from parent to child unless the child group's `isBlocked` is `true`.

200.description: The response reflects the user's modified group.

put.summary: Modify a user's group and role assignments

parameters.description: Unique identifier for each user. To get this value, run the [List users](ref:get-ui-identities) operation.
parameters.name: uiIdentityId

put.description: This operation modifies a user's basic information. Pass the entire body of data in the request, including members you're not changing, or the unspecified data are removed. To edit detailed settings, run the [Modify a user's group and role assignments](ref:put-ui-uiidentity-auth-grants) or [Update a user's notifications](ref:put-notifications) operations.

additionalAuthentication.description: Specifies the user's multi-factor authentication method, confirming their identity. Either `TFA`, `MFA`, or `NONE`, which offers no additional authentication.

contactType.description: User's contact type. To get the available values, run the [View contact types](ref:get-common-contact-types) operation.

country.description: User's country. To get the available values, run the [View supported countries](ref:get-common-countries) operation.

email.description: The user's email address. It needs to be a valid email address users can access, as they'll be sent a OTP to enter while logging in for the first time. To learn more, see [Frequently asked questions](https://techdocs.akamai.com/iam/docs/frequently-asked-questions-gss#why-am-i-asked-to-enter-a-code-while-logging-in).

jobTitle.description: The user's position at the company.

mobilePhone.description: The user's mobile phone number in ITU-T E.164 format, that is, `+country code-area code-subscriber number`. For example, `+3551234567891` or `+441234567891`. For Canadian and US phone numbers, you can provide them with a country code (for example, `+11234567891`) or without it as a ten-digit integer within a string (for example, `1234567891`).

phone.description: The user's mobile phone number in ITU-T E.164 format, that is, `+country code-area code-subscriber number`. For example, `+3551234567891` or `+441234567891`. For Canadian and US phone numbers, you can provide them with a country code (for example, `+11234567891`) or without it as a ten-digit integer within a string (for example, `1234567891`).

preferredLanguage.description: The user's language. To get the available values, run the [View languages](ref:get-common-languages) operation.

sessionTimeOut.description: The number of seconds it takes for the user's Control Center session to time out after no activity. To get the available values, run the [View timeout policies](ref:get-common-timeout-policies) operation if you're an administrator or [View timeout policies for a user profile](ref:get-user-timeout-policies) operation if you're the account's user. Make sure to select a value that's equal or smaller to the **Max session timeout** value, set for your account in the Identity and Access Management interface's [Settings](https://techdocs.akamai.com/iam/docs/account-settings) tab.

state.description: The user's state or province if user's country is USA or Canada. To get the available values, run the [View states for a user profile](ref:get-user-states) operation.

timeZone.description: The user's time zone. To get the available values, run the [View time zones](ref:get-common-timezones) operation.

zipCode.description: The user's five-digit postal code, represented as a string.

get.description: This operation lists all properties and includes a user doesn't have access to in a group. Note the responses's set of IDs refer to either properties or includes. To find out which each refers to, see [Manage access to properties and includes](ref:manage-access-to-properties-and-includes).

200.description: The response provides the blocked assets.

parameters.description: Unique identifier for each group. To get this value, run the [List groups](ref:get-groups) operation.
parameters.name: groupId

parameters.description: Unique identifier for each user. To get this value, run the [List users](ref:get-ui-identities) operation.
parameters.name: uiIdentityId

put.description: This operation updates the list of blocked properties and includes. By default, users can access all properties and includes in a group, and this operation specifies IDs for any to block. To find out which each refers to, see [Manage access to properties and includes](ref:manage-access-to-properties-and-includes). To get the list of already blocked properties run the [List blocked properties and includes](ref:get-blocked-properties) operation. In this request, include the whole list of properties you want to block. By not including a blocked property, you're unlocking it.

200.description: The response provides the unblocked properties.

parameters.description: Unique identifier for each user. To get this value, run the [List users](ref:get-ui-identities) operation.
parameters.name: uiIdentityId

post.description: This operation locks a user's account, preventing access to Control Center. The result shows in the user data as a read-only `isLocked`: `true` indicator. To allow a user access to Control Center, run the [Unlock a user's account](ref:post-ui-identity-unlock) operation. This sets the `isLocked` indicator to `false`.

parameters.description: Unique identifier for each user. To get this value, run the [List users](ref:get-ui-identities) operation.
parameters.name: uiIdentityId

put.description: This operation subscribes or unsubscribes users to product notification emails.

schema.description: Encapsulates the types of email notifications you can receive.

apiClientCredentialExpiryNotification.description: Enables notifications for expiring API client credentials.

newUserNotification.description: Enables notifications for group administrators when the user creates other new users.

proactive.description: Products for which the user gets notifications for service issues.

upgrade.description: Products for which the user receives notifications for upgrades.

200.description: The response reflects the user's email notification status.

schema.description: Encapsulates the types of email notifications you can receive.

apiClientCredentialExpiryNotification.description: Whether the user gets notifications for expiring API client credentials.

newUserNotification.description: Whether group administrators get notifications when the user creates other new users.

passwordExpiry.description: Whether the user gets notifications for password expiration.

proactive.description: Products for which the user gets notifications for service issues.

upgrade.description: Products for which the user receives notifications for upgrades.

parameters.description: Unique identifier for each user. To get this value, run the [List users](ref:get-ui-identities) operation.
parameters.name: uiIdentityId

post.description: This operation sends a one-time use password to the user. If you send the email with the password directly to the user, the response for this operation doesn't include that password. If you don't send the password to the user through email, the password is included in the response.

parameters.name: sendEmail
parameters.description: Sends a one-time password to the new user, `true` by default.

204.description: With `sendEmail` set to `true`, the 204 indicates the user's password was successfully reset.

parameters.description: Unique identifier for each user. To get this value, run the [List users](ref:get-ui-identities) operation.
parameters.name: uiIdentityId

post.description: This operation sets a password for a user. This differs from [Reset a user's password](ref:post-reset-password) because this password may be used more than once, and isn't randomly generated.

parameters.description: Unique identifier for each user. To get this value, run the [List users](ref:get-ui-identities) operation.
parameters.name: uiIdentityId

post.description: This operation releases the lock on a user's account, allowing access to Control Center. The result shows in the user data as a read-only `isLocked`:`false` indicator. To prevent a user access to Control Center, run the [Lock a user's account](ref:post-ui-identity-lock) operation. This sets the `isLocked` indicator to `true`.

roles-filter-params-group-group-id.description: Filters roles for a specific group. To get this value, run the [List groups](ref:get-groups) operation.
roles-filter-params-group-group-id.name: groupId

auth-grants-query.description: Includes the list of your group and role assignments, `false` by default.
auth-grants-query.name: authGrants

admin-actions-actions.description: Includes actions such as `edit` or `delete` that a user can perform on an object, `false` by default. Don't confuse this with the `action` parameter, which applies to the [Set two-factor authentication](ref:put-user-profile-tfa) operation.
admin-actions-actions.name: actions

send-email.name: sendEmail
send-email.description: Sends a one-time password to the new user, `true` by default.

ui-identity-id-path.description: Unique identifier for each user. To get this value, run the [List users](ref:get-ui-identities) operation.
ui-identity-id-path.name: uiIdentityId

notifications-query.description: Includes product notifications you subscribe to, `false` by default.
notifications-query.name: notifications

group-id-path.description: Unique identifier for each group. To get this value, run the [List groups](ref:get-groups) operation.
group-id-path.name: groupId

auth-grant-response.description: A user's role assignments, per group.

groupId.description: Unique identifier for each group. It's returned only for group roles.

isBlocked.description: Whether a user's access to a group is blocked.

roleDescription.description: Descriptive label for the role to convey its use.

roleId.description: Unique identifier for each role.

subGroups.description: Children of the parent group. Permissions cascade downward from parent to child unless the child group's `isBlocked` is `true`.

actions.description: Specifies permissions available to the user for this group. This data is available when you specify the `actions` parameter of the same name, not to be confused with the `action` parameter that applies to the [Set two-factor authentication](ref:put-user-profile-tfa) operation.

apiClient.description: Enables the administrator to create an API client.

canEditMFA.description: With a `true` value, the user can turn their MFA setting on or off.

canEditNone.description: With a `true` value, the user can turn their None setting on or off.

canEditTFA.description: With a `true` value, the user can turn their TFA setting on or off.

editProfile.description: With a `true` value, the user can edit their user profile.

isCloneable.description: Enables an administrator to create a new user with permissions cloned from this user.

resetPassword.description: Enables an administrator to send a user a password by email or see a one-time token.

thirdPartyAccess.description: Enables the administrator to manage extended access.

additionalAuthentication.description: Specifies the user's multi-factor authentication method, confirming their identity. Either `TFA`, `MFA`, or `NONE`, which offers no additional authentication.

additionalAuthenticationConfigured.description: Whether the user has multi-factor authentication configured.

roleId.description: Unique identifier for each role.

subGroups.description: Children of the parent group. Permissions cascade downward from parent to child unless the child group's `isBlocked` is `true`.

isLocked.description: Whether the user's account is locked. To learn more, see [Temporary account lockout](https://techdocs.akamai.com/iam/docs/tmp-account-lockout).

lastLoginDate.description: ISO 8601 timestamp indicating when the user last logged in.

uiIdentityId.description: Unique identifier for each user, which corresponds to their Control Center profile or client ID. Also known as a `contactId` in other APIs.

uiUserName.description: The user's username in Control Center.

groupId.description: Unique identifier for each group.

isBlocked.description: Blocks a user's access to a group.

roleId.description: Unique identifier for each role. To get this value, run the [List roles](ref:get-roles) operation. You need to assign at least one role to a user. Setting the value to `null` in POST leaves the default role: either unassigned or cascaded from a parent group. For `PUT`, it clears the current assignment and reverts it to the default role.

subGroups.description: Children of the parent group. Permissions cascade downward from parent to child unless the child group's `isBlocked` is `true`.

Setting the value to `null` in POST leaves the default role: either unassigned or cascaded from a parent group. For `PUT`, it clears the current assignment and reverts it to the default role.

auth-grant-request-account-role.description: The user's account level role assignments.
auth-grant-request-account-role.title: Account level role

roleId.description: Unique identifier for each role. To get this value, run the [List roles](ref:get-roles) operation and look for roles with the `account` type.

roleDescription.description: Descriptive label for the role to convey its use.

additionalAuthentication.description: Specifies the user's multi-factor authentication method, confirming their identity. Either `TFA`, `MFA`, or `NONE`, which offers no additional authentication.

authGrants.description: The user's role assignments, per group. The user needs to have at least one group role assigned. Account level roles are optional. Provide either this or the `cloneFrom`.

oneOf.title: Group role

isBlocked.description: Blocks a user's access to a group.

roleId.description: Unique identifier for each role. To get this value, run the [List roles](ref:get-roles) operation. You need to assign at least one role to a user. Setting the value to `null` in POST leaves the default role: either unassigned or cascaded from a parent group. For `PUT`, it clears the current assignment and reverts it to the default role.

groupId.description: Unique identifier for each group.

isBlocked.description: Blocks a user's access to a group.

roleId.description: Unique identifier for each role. To get this value, run the [List roles](ref:get-roles) operation. You need to assign at least one role to a user. Setting the value to `null` in POST leaves the default role: either unassigned or cascaded from a parent group. For `PUT`, it clears the current assignment and reverts it to the default role.

subGroups.description: Children of the parent group. Permissions cascade downward from parent to child unless the child group's `isBlocked` is `true`.

oneOf.description: The user's account level role assignments.
oneOf.title: Account level role

roleId.description: Unique identifier for each role. To get this value, run the [List roles](ref:get-roles) operation and look for roles with the `account` type.

roleDescription.description: Descriptive label for the role to convey its use.

cloneFrom.description: The username to clone a user's `authGrants` from. Provide either this or the `authGrants`.

contactType.description: User's contact type. To get the available values, run the [View contact types](ref:get-common-contact-types) operation.

country.description: User's country. To get the available values, run the [View supported countries](ref:get-common-countries) operation.

email.description: The user's email address. It needs to be a valid email address users can access, as they'll be sent a OTP to enter while logging in for the first time. To learn more, see [Frequently asked questions](https://techdocs.akamai.com/iam/docs/frequently-asked-questions-gss#why-am-i-asked-to-enter-a-code-while-logging-in).

jobTitle.description: The user's position at the company.

mobilePhone.description: The user's mobile phone number in ITU-T E.164 format, that is, `+country code-area code-subscriber number`. For example, `+3551234567891` or `+441234567891`. For Canadian and US phone numbers, you can provide them with a country code (for example, `+11234567891`) or without it as a ten-digit integer within a string (for example, `1234567891`).

notifications.description: Specifies email notifications the user receives for products.

apiClientCredentialExpiryNotification.description: Enables notifications for expiring API client credentials.

newUserNotification.description: Enables notifications for group administrators when the user creates other new users.

proactive.description: Products for which the user gets notifications for service issues.

upgrade.description: Products for which the user receives notifications for upgrades.

phone.description: The user's mobile phone number in ITU-T E.164 format, that is, `+country code-area code-subscriber number`. For example, `+3551234567891` or `+441234567891`. For Canadian and US phone numbers, you can provide them with a country code (for example, `+11234567891`) or without it as a ten-digit integer within a string (for example, `1234567891`).

preferredLanguage.description: The user's language. To get the available values, run the [View languages](ref:get-common-languages) operation.

sessionTimeOut.description: The number of seconds it takes for the user's Control Center session to time out after no activity. To get the available values, run the [View timeout policies](ref:get-common-timeout-policies) operation. Make sure to select a value that's equal or smaller to the **Max session timeout** value, set for your account in the Identity and Access Management interface's [Settings](https://techdocs.akamai.com/iam/docs/account-settings) tab.

state.description: The user's state or province if user's country is USA or Canada. To get the available values, run the [View states for a user profile](ref:get-user-states) operation.

timeZone.description: The user's time zone. To get the available values, run the [View time zones](ref:get-common-timezones) operation.

zipCode.description: The user's five-digit postal code, represented as a string.

actions.description: Specifies permissions available to the user for this group. This data is available when you specify the `actions` parameter of the same name, not to be confused with the `action` parameter that applies to the [Set two-factor authentication](ref:put-user-profile-tfa) operation.

additionalAuthentication.description: Specifies the user's multi-factor authentication method, confirming their identity. Either `TFA`, `MFA`, or `NONE`, which offers no additional authentication.

subGroups.description: Children of the parent group. Permissions cascade downward from parent to child unless the child group's `isBlocked` is `true`.

emailUpdatePending.description: Whether there are any pending changes to the email address.

isLocked.description: Whether the user's account is locked. To learn more, see [Temporary account lockout](https://techdocs.akamai.com/iam/docs/tmp-account-lockout).

uiUserName.description: The user's username in Control Center.

zipCode.description: The user's five-digit postal code, represented as a string.

value.description: A user's multi-factor authentication method, either `TFA`, `MFA`, or `NONE`.
